input:
Definition: In this task, you will be given a short story. One sentence from the story is chosen. Consider the events that happen before that sentence, or are likely to have happened before it. Does any of them directly cause it, or simply make it possible? You should write your answer in the form " A >causes/enables> B". Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: Sal was a grumpy person. He had no friends and hated almost everything. He went to town to pick up gifts. They were for himself because he like almost no one. Later that night he cried himself to sleep.
 selected sentence: They were for himself because he like almost no one.
output:
output: Sal doesn't have friends >Causes/Enables> Sal buys gifts for himself

Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: The weather turned cold and foul by Jim's house. There was icy rain and the wind blew hard. Jim saw that his front steps were covered in ice. He took some salt from his garage and spread it on the steps. The ice melted a little so Jim added even more salt.
 selected sentence: He took some salt from his garage and spread it on the steps.
output:
output: The front steps are covered in ice >Causes/Enables> Jim spreds salt on the steps

Does any of them directly cause it, or simply make it possible? You should write your answer in the form " A >causes/enables> B". Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: Sam was cold. It was the middle of winter. She went to the store. She bought a new scarf and hat. She felt warmer with her new clothing.
 selected sentence: She bought a new scarf and hat.
output:
output: Sam goes to the store >Causes/Enables> Sam buys a hat

Does any of them directly cause it, or simply make it possible? You should write your answer in the form " A >causes/enables> B". Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: Gina went into her grandpa's room. It was the first time she had been in there since he died. She looked at and picked up items from the dresser. She opened the drawers and cabinets and peeked inside. There stood the clothes she would never see him wear again.
 selected sentence: She opened the drawers and cabinets and peeked inside.
output:
output: Gina decides to open >Causes/Enables> Gina opens

Does any of them directly cause it, or simply make it possible? You should write your answer in the form " A >causes/enables> B". Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: Once, a monkey got into my girlfriend's house in India. The monkey was eating almonds out of a glass jar. My girlfriend was terrified, then the monkey screamed. It ran out the window, thankfully. She still hates monkeys to this day.
 selected sentence: It ran out the window, thankfully.
output:
output: A monkey gets into my girlfriend's house >Causes/Enables> The monkey runs out the window

Does any of them directly cause it, or simply make it possible? You should write your answer in the form " A >causes/enables> B". Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: One day John tried to move the TV. Eventually he tripped. The TV fell on the floor and broke. John was upset because he loved watching TV. He ended up buying a new one.
 selected sentence: One day John tried to move the TV.
output:
output: John rearranges the living room >Causes/Enables> John moves the tv

Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: A bully in Tim's class stole his lunch. Tim asked him to return it, but he wouldn't. Tim didn't like violence, but he punched the boy anyway. The boy fell and started crying loudly. The teacher sent Tim to the principal's office for punishment!
 selected sentence: The teacher sent Tim to the principal's office for punishment!
output:
output: The teacher decides to send >Causes/Enables> The teacher sends

Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: Judy wanted to go to a new restaurant for the first time. She was very excited to try the food there. When Judy got to the place she saw a rat outside. She decided that she didn't want to eat at the new restaurant. Judy ate leftovers at home.
 selected sentence: She decided that she didn't want to eat at the new restaurant.
output:
output: She sees a rat outside >Causes/Enables> She doesn't want to eat at the new restaurant

Try to use phrases and sentences from the story to compose your answer when possible.
Positive example 1-
input: story: It was bedtime at our house. Two of the three kids hit the pillow and fall asleep. The third is a trouble maker. For two hours he continues to get out of bed and want to play. Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
 selected sentence: Finally he becomes tired and falls asleep.
output: A kid wants to play before sleep >Causes/Enables> A kid eventually falls asleep
Positive example 2-
input: story: Cindy woke up late. Cindy forgot her homework. Cindy dropped food on her skirt. She thought it was the worst day ever. She got home and her parents took her for ice cream and it wasn't bad.
 selected sentence: Cindy dropped food on her skirt.
output: Cindy eats >Causes/Enables> Cindy drops food on  her skirt
Now complete the following example-
input: story: An old man walked with a cane. He started to fall on the ice. A person looking out for him saved him. The man was so thankful. The man bought the person a drink.
 selected sentence: The man was so thankful.
output:
output: A person saves him >Causes/Enables> The man is thankful
